item.title: Lee add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Lee add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Lee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Lee add a quote by Shirley MacLaine
item.description: "Fear makes strangers of people who would be friends." -- Shirley MacLaine

item.title: Lee add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something. Don’t wait for good things to happen to you. If you go out and make some good things happen, you will fill the world with hope, you will fill yourself with hope." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Lee add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "I suggest that the only books that influence us are those for which we are ready, and which have gone a little further down our particular path than we have yet gone ourselves." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Lee add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description:
"A mother's love for her child is like nothing else in the world. It knows no law, no pity. It dares all things and crushes down remorselessly all that stands in its path.
<i>-The Last Seance (from The Hound of Death and Other Stories, also Double Sin and Other Stories)</i>" -- Agatha Christie

item.title: Lee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Lee add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Lee add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "The most difficult times for many of us are the ones we give ourselves." -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Lee add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Just how destructive does a culinary preference have to be before we decide to eat something else? If contributing to the suffering of billions of animals that live miserable lives and (quite often) die in horrific ways isn't motivating, what would be? If being the number one contributor to the most serious threat facing the planet (global warming) isn't enough, what is? And if you are tempted to put off these questions of conscience, to say not now, then when?" -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Lee add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Lee add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Children must be taught how to think, not what to think." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Lee add a quote by Nikos Kazantzakis
item.description: "True teachers are those who use themselves as bridges over which they invite their students to cross; then, having facilitated their crossing, joyfully collapse, encouraging them to create their own." -- Nikos Kazantzakis

item.title: Lee add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Lee add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description:
"What an astonishing thing a book is. It's a flat object made from a tree with flexible parts on which are imprinted lots of funny dark squiggles. But one glance at it and you're inside the mind of another person, maybe somebody dead for thousands of years. Across the millennia, an author is speaking clearly and silently inside your head, directly to you. Writing is perhaps the greatest of human inventions, binding together people who never knew each other, citizens of distant epochs. Books break the shackles of time. A book is proof that humans are capable of working magic."
[<i>Cosmos, Part 11: The Persistence of Memory</i> (1980)]" -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Lee add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "It is not the brains that matter most, but that which guides them — the character, the heart, generous qualities, progressive ideas." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Lee add a quote by Horace Mann
item.description: "A house without books is like a room without windows." -- Horace Mann
